metadata.name: Crash Euphoria #15
metadata.description:
My first foray into shaders and GLSL: This piece experiments with layering many textures guided by an underlying pattern. Each pixel value dictates which pattern is displayed. There are varying levels of imperfections in each pattern, some choose a single color, some use a color guide pattern, some individual strokes decide on another color altogether. These layers are compiled in a shader and warped.

Press 's' in live view to save a png

Created with p5.js and chroma.js

metadata.name: Bloomside of The Past Field #22
metadata.description:
Made this work as a part of trying to make misprint effects, while maintaining the square form.
The scene are the flowers and other vegetations. Sometimes the scene will have the rain, snow and other weathers.

I imagined the scene was a form of painting, drawing or pictures on the postcard. So, all of them will have been signed as a loved sign, dusted sign (the spiders will come) and left unsigned. 

-----
The grain function which I used from Gorilla Sun Fx(text)
written in p5js. 
-----
my friends are married and getting married. I was left and I'm growing the flowers for myself in the sideline of the park, house, or elsewhere.

metadata.name: n Forms #248
metadata.description:
Hand-scrawled documentation of abstract structures. A journal from another realm.

Press 's' to save an image while in full-screen mode.

If you want to increase the resolution of the saved image, add e.g. &size=2000 after the live/fullscreen view URL to render the canvas at that specific pixel width (default = browser sized). This will be dependent on your system specifications, but outputs of up to 8000px wide, or above, should be possible.

Usually loads best in Chrome

metadata.name: Origin-a-tions III: Imagination #117
metadata.description:
The closer we look at things, the more different they will seem to us. The more we try to see what is, the more we will see what is not. Only our Imagination will fill the gap in-between.

Origin-a-tions is a three-parts series of generative artwork, started with Part I: Creation, continued with Part II: Formation, and concluded with Part III: Imagination, that depicts one possible variation of how things may be originating.

* * *

Press S to save as PNG.

Made by: yenren / twitter.com/yenrenART
License: LICENSE.txt

metadata.name: 3ASF #58
metadata.description:
3 Armonografos Sobre Figuras / 3 Harmonographs on Shapes

"If I had to choose, the harmonograph is my preferred mechanism for making gen art"

The composition works with three harmonographs vertically distributed with 2 pendulums each that draw on black and white shapes. It is a game between the positive and the negative.

Steps-Layers:

1 - White or black background
2 - Draw shape 1 (triangle or Circle or Rectangle) with the opposite tone to the background.
3 - Draw shape 2 (triangle or Circle or Rectangle) same tone as the background.
4 - Draw the 3 Harmonographs. The (inverted) tones depend on the tones of the shapes and background.
5 - Cutting / glitch effect. Vertical and horizontal.
6 - Symmetries X or Y or XY or none are applied.
7 - Rectangles are cut again (yes/no)

// ---

"Si tuviese que elegir, el armonografo es mi mecanismo preferido para hacer arte generativo"

La composici√≥n trabaja con tres arm√≥nografos de 2 p√©ndulos distribu√≠dos verticalmente que dibujan sobre figuras en blanco y negro. Es un juego entre positivos y negativos.

Pasos-Capas: 

1 - Fondo blanco o negro
2 - Dibuja figura 1 (triangulo o Circulo o Rectangulo) con tono opuesto al fondo.
3 - Dibuja figura 2 (triangulo o Circulo o Rectangulo) mismo tono que el fondo.
4 - Dibuja los 3 Armon√≥grafos. Los tonos (invertidos) dependen de los tonos de la figura y el fondo.
5 - Se corta / efecto glitch. Vertical y horizontal.
6 - Se aplican simetrias X o Y o XY o ninguna.
7 - Se cortan nuevamente rect√°ngulos (si/no)

// ---
Keys:

[1,2,3] -> change pixel density. Or can be passed via url ?pd=5 6000x9000pix. Be aware for the file size in render. 
[s] -> download canvas capture. Different pixel density, different sizes.
[double tap] -> download canvas capture on mobile

metadata.name: ùôÇùô°ùô§ùô®ùô®ùôñ-ùôûùô£-ùôÇùôöùô£ùôñ #10
metadata.description:
"ùôÇùô°ùô§ùô®ùô®ùôñ-ùôûùô£-ùôÇùôöùô£ùôñ"
by pixelwank 

The glossa is an insect's tongue. The gena is its cheek.

Bright and playful. Dark and boding. Forms appear amongst the calm and the chaos.  

Thanks for collecting!

Press 's' or 'S' in live mode to download png

Acknowledgments:
Big thanks to Bruce, Studio Yorktown for sharing the 'Color Town Hall'. 7 appear in this work and are under the Town Hall trait. 
https://studioyorktown.github.io/coloryorktownhall/
Also shoutouts to Steve's Makerspace who's recent youtube content has been very insightful <3  

Made with p5js
¬© pixelwank
December 2022

metadata.name: Ceremony #111
metadata.description:
This series celebrates fxhash turning one. #fxhashturnsone

I‚Äôm so grateful for this place and have ho idea how to adequately articulate how much this platform has changed my life, but it has. A million thanks to the team. You are so appreciated as are the artists and collectors that have made this such a beautiful community. ü•Ç

Definitely check out ‚ÄúForever‚Äù mode by tapping ‚ÄúF‚Äù or mouse click/tap ‚Äî it will animate (you guessed it) forever and will change its layout every 365 frames, in honor of this wonderful year, and every year after. Some forever modes will ‚Äúnever forget‚Äù and others will fade as they progress. No idea if that‚Äôs a metaphor but it is a trait, that much I know.

All primary sales are donated to Code/Art, which is a charity that uses ‚Äú‚Ä¶Art to Inspire Girls in Computer Science.‚Äù Read about Code/Art here: https://www.code-art.com/

Ceremony uses public domain art (which is the original, more implicit version CC0) made exclusively by women.

See fxtext article linked from the project page for a gallery of the source material and other notes.

Ceremony is also CC0, so feel free use anything here in other projects.

You can read more about CC0 here:
https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/

F : ‚ÄúForever‚Äù mode (tap after initial render completes)
P : Pause/Play
(mouse click/tap also works to start ‚ÄúForever‚Äù mode or Pause/Play)

A : Add Grain (only works when paused in ‚ÄúForever‚Äù mode.)
G : Toggle Grain (resets the whole piece)
M : Toggle Matte (resets the whole piece)

S : Save Image
1 -> 6 : Set pixel density (resets the whole piece)
(Default pixel density is 1 @ 2000x2000)

If you want to start in "Forever" mode, you can append "&forever=true" to the url in the live view.
You can also add pixel density to the url by appending ‚Äú&density=2‚Äù (or 3, 4, etc) to have it render at higher resolutions by default.

metadata.name: The Good Corals #69
metadata.description: Generative corals  -   but in a good way

metadata.name: ‚öñÔ∏è Concord #162
metadata.description:
An experiment between pen-plotter, ink, paper and digital. A visual Koan in which our brain finds balance. In a sometimes overwhelming digital world, this art is an attempt to a respite.

Generative NFT by revdancatt of Dan Catt Contemporary Print, 2021
This version in digital.
Designed to print at standard A2, A3, A4, A5 size, works well as triptych.

ig: instagram.com/revdancatt
tw: twitter.com/revdancatt

metadata.name: Artifice #196
metadata.description:
This series is is about playful obfuscation.

The fxtext article linked on the main profect goes more in-depth into what is meant by that, as well as the events that led to this collection.

5640 bytes of Vanilla JS with no libraries. Palettes make up a third of the code.

In live mode:
‚ÄòS‚Äô : save as png (3000‚Ää√ó‚Ää3600)
‚ÄôV‚Äô : save as svg (without grain)

URL params in live mode:
‚Äòg=n‚Äô : no grain
‚Äòg=p‚Äô : paper grain
‚Äòh=t‚Äô : high resolution mode, 9000‚Ää√ó10600 (Chrome only, and may take a moment)

For example, if you wanted paper grain in high resolution, append ‚Äú&g=p&h=t‚Äù to the url in live mode.

After rendering with these params, tapping 'P' will then save a png with those settings applied.
